original: @193a rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @193a rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: de bi ma h'a k'a li n'a ma dha ra ni /
analyzed: de bi ma h'a k'a li n'a ma dha ra ni /
translated: Devi Mahakali-nama-dharani

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lha mo nag mo chen mo'i gzungs /
analyzed: lha mo nag mo chen mo'i gzungs /
translated: The Dhāraṇī of Great Black Goddess

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon pa zhig na byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon pa zhig na byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs so //
translated: the Blessed One, not long after his full enlightenment, was dwelling at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: de nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug ma bdud kyi yum /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug ma bdud kyi yum /
translated: Then the Queen of the Desire Realm, the Mother of Mara,

original: gshin rje'i lcam mo /
analyzed: gshin rje'i lcam mo /
translated: the Wife of Yama,

original: lha mo nag mo chen mos bcom ldan @193b 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: lha mo nag mo chen mos bcom ldan @193b 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: the Great Black Goddess, circumambulated the Blessed One three times and sat to one side.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha mo nag mo chen mos gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha mo nag mo chen mos gsol pa /
translated: Then the Great Black Goddess said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba'i rig pa 'di 'bul na /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba'i rig pa 'di 'bul na /
translated: Venerable Blessed One, I offer this knowledge of paying homage at your feet.

original: bdag gis de bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: bdag gis de bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes su gsol /
translated: Please accept it from me, Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said:

original: bdud kyi yum gshin rje'i lcam mo nag mo chen mos steng du ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed la thug pa man chad bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi yum gshin rje'i lcam mo nag mo chen mos steng du ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed la thug pa man chad bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The mother of Mara, the great black wife of Yama, should bind above as far as the heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations.

original: 'og tu ni sems can dmyal ba la thug pa yan chad bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu ni sems can dmyal ba la thug pa yan chad bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Below, she should bind as far as the hells.

original: thad ka kho ra khor yug tu ni ri la thug pa tshun chad bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: thad ka kho ra khor yug tu ni ri la thug pa tshun chad bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Horizontally, she should bind as far as the mountains.

original: de'i sngags 'di dag kyang bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i sngags 'di dag kyang bzlas par bya ste /
translated: These mantras of hers should also be recited:

original: tadya th'a / aom ru ru ro ru bi tishtha ba to si ru ru ro ru bi tishtha b'a to si sv'a h'a /
analyzed: tadya th'a / aom ru ru ro ru bi tishtha ba to si ru ru ro ru bi tishtha b'a to si sv'a h'a /
translated: Tadyatha Om ruru ro ru visthapata vatosi ruru ro ru visthapata vatosi svaha.

original: 'di bton pas rims dang / nad dang / mi ngas dang / nyes bar bltas ba thams cad dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa la sogs pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro sv'a h'a /
analyzed: 'di bton pas rims dang / nad dang / mi ngas dang / nyes bar bltas ba thams cad dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / g-yan pa la sogs pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro sv'a h'a /
translated: By reciting this, all fevers, illnesses, famines, misfortunes, leprosy, boils, itching, and so on, will be pacified.

original: lha mo nag mo chen mo'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: lha mo nag mo chen mo'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The Dhāraṇī of the Great Black Goddess is complete.
